body_html: Lets example of CNN input: (Nbsample, X, Y, Z) X, Y: 2D Z: color depth NbSample: nb of sample We wish to add one more dimension in LSTM input (ex: to represent color depth). Regards Kevin On 8 Jul 2017, at 09:38, Cliff Young <notifications@github.com> wrote: What does the extra_dim1 argument do? You haven't modified any of the rest of the code, so I don't see how it should affect the operation of the LSTM cells. Can you not just fold it into the batch dimension? ― You are receiving this because you authored the thread. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
body_text:
Lets example of CNN input:

(Nbsample,  X, Y, Z)
X, Y: 2D
Z: color depth
NbSample: nb of sample

We wish to add one more dimension in LSTM input (ex: to represent color depth).


Regards
Kevin










On 8 Jul 2017, at 09:38, Cliff Young <notifications@github.com> wrote:

What does the extra_dim1 argument do? You haven't modified any of the rest of the code, so I don't see how it should affect the operation of the LSTM cells. Can you not just fold it into the batch dimension?

―
You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
body:
Lets example of CNN input:

(Nbsample,  X, Y, Z)
X, Y: 2D
Z: color depth
NbSample: nb of sample

We wish to add one more dimension in LSTM input (ex: to represent color depth).


Regards
Kevin










On 8 Jul 2017, at 09:38, Cliff Young <notifications@github.com> wrote:

What does the extra_dim1 argument do? You haven't modified any of the rest of the code, so I don't see how it should affect the operation of the LSTM cells. Can you not just fold it into the batch dimension?

―
